name: Children of Fafnir
description:
Children of Fafnir is a wholesome VR puzzle platformer for Oculus Quest and PCVR where you must rescue a bunch of tiny dragons.

  • 🐉  control tiny dragons
  • 🛠  play with physics objects
  • 🏝  adorable miniature floating islands
  • 🧩  simple but satisfying puzzles
  • 🔮  a mysterious ending
  • 💸  free!

The game is currently available as a 💸 free early access demo. This version includes 7 levels, representing the first area of the game and accounting for roughly ⏱ 45 minutes to 1 hour of gameplay.

The game is available for Oculus Quest (1 & 2) and PCVR.

On Oculus Quest, the game is available via Oculus app lab at this link.

On PC, the game has been tested with an Oculus Rift S and an Oculus Quest 2. Other headsets should be supported, but I've not been able to test the game to verify this. If you run the game on another headset please let me know of any issues you run into & I will do my best to fix them (and if it just works™ let me know so that I can update this description!).

The game is under active development and feedback is very welcome! If you wish to follow along with my progress I sporadically post updates, as well as occasionally provide tidbits of gamedev and ue4 wisdom, on twitter @iameviltom.

Children of Fafnir is a one person endeavour, but it wouldn't be possible without the following people who so kindly share their art online for all to build upon:

  • @ben_burnes 🎼 music
  • @KenneyNL 🏡 3D models and sfx
  • @KayLousberg 🌲 3D models
  • @quaternius 👨 3D models
  • @suriyunstudio 🐉 the wonderful little dragons
  • @sonnissdotcom 🎵 sfx & ambient audio
  • @Namatnieks 🎨 Na16 colour palette
  • Vanilla and Cream 🔤 Catamaran font
